title: CJP holds meeting with law officers
content:
ISLAMABAD, Sep 28 (APP):The Chief Justice and Senior Puisne Judge of the Supreme Court Thursday held a meeting with the Attorney-General for Pakistan, the Advocates-General, the Prosecutors-General of the provinces, and of the National Accountability Bureau.
The Chief Justice welcomed the participants and pointed out that the largest litigants in the Supreme Court are the Federal and provincial governments, which makes their law officers a crucial component of Pakistanâ€™s legal system, but one that has historically had little say in how the system operates.
Every law officer was in turn called upon to provide suggestions for improving the efficiency and working of the Supreme Court, according to a press release.
The law officers appreciated the issuance of the monthly cause list for October 2023 and hoped that this practice would continue. They also pointed out that supplementary cause lists are issued very late and they are not given sufficient time to prepare their cases. They were assured that their concern would be considered.
Other valuable suggestions were made, some of which were accepted, and others would be examined. The law officers thanked the Chief Justice and Senior Puisne Judge for hosting the meeting, which they said was a first of its kind.
